prop.head.headtext: Practical Advice for Protecting Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: For numerous reasons, businesses supply a large volume of information to the government. Often this provision of information will be dictated by legislative requirements or supplied in the normal course of business as part of a tender bid or proposal process. At times, such information will include confidential business information. When any business information is provided to the government, careful consideration should be given to the content as well as the legislative protections and remedies available to prevent subsequent disclosure. The following two sections will briefly discuss the issue of legislative disclosure.
